category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Architecture and Fine Arts (CAFA), offers the Bachelor of Fine Arts program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 180 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and one summer term, incorporating general education, technical artistic skills, and professional courses.

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum
content: The First Year curriculum for the Bachelor of Fine Arts at EARIST is divided into two semesters. The First Semester requires 26 credited units and includes foundational courses: Drawing I (DRAWING1), Materials I/Modeling 1 (MATRALS1), Techniques I/Freehand Drawing 1 (TECHNOS1), Visual Perception 1/Elements of Visual Arts (VISPERC1), and History of World Arts (HISTWART). General education subjects include Contextualized Communication in Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURCO), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester also requires 26 credited units. Major courses include Drafting and Perspective (DRAFTPER), Drawing II (DRAWING2), Materials II/Modeling 2 (MATRALS2), Techniques II/Freehand Drawing 2 (TECHNOS2), and Visual Perception 2/Concept of Visual Organization (VISPERC2). General subjects include Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Philippine Literature (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFTE), and NSTP 2.

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum
content: The Second Year of the EARIST Bachelor of Fine Arts program focuses on intermediate visual studies and ethics. The First Semester consists of 23 credited units featuring Materials III/Concept, Techniques, Process (MATRALS3), Techniques III/Color and Form 1 (TECHNQS3), and Visual Studies 1/Composition 1 (VISSTUD1). Required general education courses are Gender and Society (GEELECGS), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Sinesosyedad (GESINEPP), and Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS). The Second Semester requires 26 credited units. It continues with Materials IV (MATRALS4), Techniques IV/Color and Form 2 (TECHNQS4), Visual Studies 2/Composition 2 (VISSTUD2), and Oriental Arts (ORIEARTS). Additional requirements include Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Business Correspondence and Research Writing (GEELECCP), Ethics (GEETHICS), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), and Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2).

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer OJT
content: The Third Year of the EARIST Bachelor of Fine Arts program introduces advanced digital tools and painting concepts. The First Semester (24 units) comprises Advanced Visual Studies 1 (ADVISTU1), Art Theory 1 (ARTTHEO1), Art Workshop 1/Adobe Photoshop (ARTWORK1), Basic to Advance Photography (BTAPHOTO), and Painting 1/Exploration and Analysis of Concept (PAINTING1). General subjects include The Contemporary World, Readings in Philippine History, and Philippine Art. The Second Semester (24 units) includes Advanced Visual Studies 2 (ADVISTU2), Art Theory 2 (ARTTHEO2), Art Workshop 2/Corel Draw (ARTWORK2), Costume & Fashion Design (FASHDES), Gallery Visit and Cultural Heritage Tour (GACULHER), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Science and Technology (GESCIENTS), and Painting 2/Portfolio Presentation (PAINTING2). The Summer term requires Cooperative Education/On-the-Job Training (COOPEDUC), which consists of 200 hours and grants 3 credited units.

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST Bachelor of Fine Arts program is dedicated to research, seminars, and final thesis production. The First Semester (14 units) includes Art Seminar 1/Art Issues 1 (ARTSEMR1), Art Work 3/Print Art (ARTWORK3), Environmental Science (GEELECES), and Research Methods in the Arts (RESMETAR), which is a 5-unit course. The Second Semester (14 units) marks the completion of the program with Art Seminar 2/Art Issues (ARTSEMR2), Art Workshop 4/Installation Art and Mural Painting (ARTWORK4), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), and the capstone Thesis course (THESISPT), which carries 5 credited units. This final year ensures students are prepared for professional practice through installation art, mural painting, and academic research.

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Visual Communication)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Architecture and Fine Arts (CAFA), offers a Bachelor of Fine Arts program specializing in Visual Communication. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 186 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and includes a summer term for cooperative education.

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Visual Communication)
content: The First Year curriculum for the Bachelor of Fine Arts (Visual Communication) at EARIST is divided into two semesters. The First Semester requires 29 credited units and includes Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Contextualized Communication in Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURCO), History of World Arts (HISTWART), Lettering (LETTRING), Materials I/Modeling 1 (MATRALS1), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), Techniques I/Freehand Drawing 1 (TECHNQS1), and Visual Perception 1/Elements of Visual Arts (VISPERC1). The Second Semester requires 26 credited units. Courses include Drafting and Perspective (DRAFTPER), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Materials II/Modeling 2 (MATRALS2), NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2), Oriental Arts (ORIEARTS), Techniques II/Freehand Drawing 2 (TECHNOS2), and Visual Perception 2/Concept of Visual Organization (VISPERC2).

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Visual Communication)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BFA Visual Communication program focuses on digital design and photography. The First Semester (26 units) includes Digital Design 1 (DGTLDES1), Figure Drawing 1 (FIGDRAW1), Gender and Society (GEELECGS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Sinesosyedad/Pelikulang Panlipunan (GESINEPP), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Photography 1 (PHOTOGH1), Production Technique 1 (PRODTEC1), and Visual Communication Design 1 (VISCODE1). The Second Semester (23 units) continues these sequences with Digital Design 2 (DGTLDES2), Figure Drawing 2 (FIGDRAW2), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence and Research Writing (GEELECCP), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Photography 2 (PHOTOGH2), Production Technique 2 (PRODTEC2), and Visual Communication Design 2 (VISCODE2).

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Visual Communication)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer OJT
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BFA Visual Communication program advances into design theory and specialized media. The First Semester (24 units) comprises Design Theory (DGTHEORY), Digital Design 3 (DGTLDES3), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Philippine Art (PHILARTS), Basic to Advanced Textile Design (TEXTDESI), Visual Communication Design 3 (VISCODE3), and Visual Verbal Communication (VISVERCO). The Second Semester (24 units) includes Creative Research (CREATRES), Digital Design 4 (DGTLDES4), Costume & Fashion Design (FASHDES), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Problem in Visual Communication (PROVISCO), and Visual Communication Design 4 (VISCODE4). The Summer term requires Cooperative Education/On-the-Job Training (COOPEDUC), consisting of 200 hours for 3 credited units.

category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Visual Communication)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BFA Visual Communication program focuses on professional portfolio development, packaging design, and thesis. The First Semester (17 units) includes Environmental Science (GEELECES), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Basic to Advanced Package Design (PACKDESI), Portfolio (PRTFOLIO), and Research Methods in Visual Communication (RESMETVC), which is a 5-unit course. The Second Semester (14 units) concludes the degree with Basic to Advanced Print Making (PRINTMAK), Seminar in Creative Management (SEMCREMA), Visual Merchandising (VISMECHA), and the capstone Thesis (THESISVC), which carries 5 credited units.

source: EARIST BS Architecture Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Architecture)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Architecture and Fine Arts (CAFA), offers the Bachelor of Science in Architecture program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 214 units for completion. The program is a five-year course that includes general education, technical architectural training, and industry immersion.

source: EARIST BS Architecture Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Architecture)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Architecture program focuses on design fundamentals and visual communication. The First Semester (24 credited units) includes Architectural Design 1 (Introduction to Design), Architectural Visual Communication 1 (Graphics 1), History of Architecture 1, Theory of Architecture 1, and Architectural Visual Communication 2 (Visual Techniques 1). General subjects include Contextualized Communication in Filipino, Mathematics in the Modern World, Movement Enhancement, Solid Mensuration, and NSTP 1. The Second Semester (25 credited units) advances to Building Technology 1 (Building Materials), Architectural Design 2 (Creative Design and Fundamentals), Architectural Visual Communication 3 (Graphics 2), Architectural Interiors, Theory of Architecture 2, and Architectural Visual Communication 4 (Visual Techniques 2). It also requires Differential and Integral Calculus, Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina, Fitness Exercises, and NSTP 2.

source: EARIST BS Architecture Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Architecture)
content: The Second Year of the BS Architecture program introduces technical systems and structural concepts. The First Semester (23 credited units) covers Building Utilities 1 (Plumbing and Sanitary Systems), Architectural Design 3 (Creative Design in Architectural Interiors), History of Architecture 2, Tropical Design, and Architectural Visual Communication 5 (Visual Techniques 3). General courses include Art Appreciation, The Contemporary World, Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1, and Science, Technology and Society. The Second Semester (25 credited units) includes Building Technology 2 (Construction Drawings in Wood, Steel, and Concrete for 1-Storey), Architectural Design 4 (Space Planning 1), History of Architecture 3, Statics of Rigid Bodies, and Surveying. Additional general courses are Living in Information Technology Era, Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II, Purposive Communication, and Readings in Philippine History.

source: EARIST BS Architecture Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Architecture)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer Immersion
content: The Third Year of the BS Architecture program focuses on advanced construction, digital tools, and structural theory. The First Semester (20 credited units) includes Building Technology 3 (Construction Drawings for 2-Storey Residential), Building Utilities 2 (Electrical, Electronics, and Mechanical Systems), Computer-Aided Design and Drafting 1 (ARCADD11), Architectural Design 5 (Space Planning 2), History of Architecture 4, and Strength of Materials. The Second Semester (24 credited units) covers Building Technology 4 (Specification Writing and Quantity Surveying), Building Utilities 3 (Acoustics and Lighting Systems), Computer-Aided Design and Drafting 2/BIM (ARCADD12), Architectural Design 6 (Site Development, Planning, and Landscaping), Planning 1 (Site Planning and Landscape Architecture), Professional Practice 1 (Laws), Practical Data Science, and Theory of Structures. The Summer term requires Industry Immersion (3 units), which has extensive prerequisites including Surveying, Strength of Materials, Statics, Calculus, and various Visual Communication courses.

source: EARIST BS Architecture Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Architecture)
content: The Fourth Year of the BS Architecture program emphasizes urban design and professional practice. The First Semester (20 credited units) includes Architectural Design 7 (Community Architecture and Urban Design), Building Technology 5 (Alternative Building Construction Systems), Planning 2 (Fundamentals of Urban Design and Community Architecture), Professional Practice 2 (Administering Regular Services), Steel and Timber Design, and The Life and Works of Rizal. The Second Semester (20 credited units) covers Research Method for Architecture, Architectural Design 8 (Design of Complex Structure), Specialization 1 (Construction Project Management), Planning 3 (Introduction to Urban and Regional Planning), Professional Practice 3 (Global Practice in the 21st Century), and Ethics.

source: EARIST BS Architecture Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Architecture)
content: The Fifth Year of the BS Architecture program is the capstone year focused on thesis and specialized management. The First Semester (16 credited units) includes Business Management and Application for Architecture 1, Architectural Structures, Architectural Design 9 (Thesis Research Writing), Specialization 2 (Construction Time Management), and Human Settlements and Housing. The Second Semester (14 credited units) concludes the degree with Specialization 3 (Construction Resource Management), Business Management and Application for Architecture 2, Understanding the Self, and Architectural Design 10 (Thesis Research Application).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Business and Public Administration (CBPA), offers the Bachelor of Science in Business Administration program specializing in Human Resource Management. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 140 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and concludes with a 600-hour practicum requirement.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Business Administration

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSBA (Human Resource Management) program is divided into two semesters. The First Semester (26 units) includes Administrative Office Procedure and Management (ADOPMNGT), Administrative Work Values and Accountability (ADWOVAAC), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Human Resource Management (HURSMNGT), Keyboarding and Documents Processing 1 (KEYDOCPR), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), and Management/Organization and Management (ORGNMNGT). The Second Semester (20 units) includes Ethics (GEETHICS), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Good Governance and Social Responsibility (GOVSORES), NSTP Civic Welfare Training Service 2 (NSTP-CWTS_2), and Recruitment and Selection (RCRTSELC).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSBA-HRM program focuses on fundamental business laws, economics, and specialized HR functions. The First Semester (23 units) comprises Accounting for Service and Trading Industry (ACCOUNT1), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Science and Technology (GESCIENTS), Labor Laws and Legislation (LBRLWLEG), Microeconomics (MICROECO), Operations Management/TQM (OPTNMNGT), and Training and Development (TRNGDEVT). The Second Semester (20 units) covers Accounting for Merchandising Industry (ACCOUNT2), Compensation Administration (COMPEADM), Entrepreneurial Management (ENTREMGT), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), and Labor Relations & Negotiations (LBRRLNEG).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSBA-HRM program emphasizes research, taxation, and organizational development. The First Semester (18 units) includes The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Philippine Literature (GEPHILIT), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Business Research in HRM/Thesis 1 (HRBUSRS1), Income Taxation (INCMTAXN), and Project Management (PROJMNGT). The Second Semester (18 units) includes Taxation 2/Business Taxation (BUSITAXN), Franchising (FRANCHIS), Business Research in HRM/Thesis 2 (HRBUSRS2), International Business and Trade (INTLBATT), Managerial Accounting (MGRLACCT), and Organizational Development (ORGNDEVT).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSBA-HRM program concludes the degree with legal studies, strategic management, and internship. The First Semester (9 units) requires Business Law/Obligations & Contract (BUSLWOBL), Special Topics in HRM (SPCLHRDM), and Strategic Management (STRAMNGT). The Second Semester (6 units) is dedicated entirely to the HRM Practicum (HRDMPRAC), which requires 600 hours of on-the-job training.

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Marketing Management)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Business and Public Administration (CBPA), offers the Bachelor of Science in Business Administration program specializing in Marketing Management. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 146 units for completion. The program is designed to provide students with a strong foundation in business marketing, advertising, and research over the course of four academic years.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Business Administration

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Marketing Management)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSBA (Marketing Management) program is divided into two semesters. The First Semester (26 units) includes Administrative Work Values and Accountability (ADWOVAAC), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Human Resource Management (HURSMNGT), Keyboarding and Documents Processing 1 (KEYDOCPR), Microeconomics (MICROECO), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), and Management/Organization and Management (ORGNMNGT). The Second Semester (23 units) introduces the major with Business Marketing (BUSIMKTG). Other courses include Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Good Governance and Social Responsibility (GOVSORES), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Marketing Management)
content: The Second Year of the BSBA Marketing Management program focuses on core business functions and specialized marketing strategies. The First Semester (20 units) requires Accounting for Service and Trading Industry (ACCOUNT1), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Marketing Management (MKTGMNGT), and Retail Management (RETLMNGT). The Second Semester (23 units) covers Accounting for Merchandising Industry (ACCOUNT2), Advertising (ADVERTSG), Consumer Behavior (CONSBHVR), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Market Research and Consumer Behavior (MKTRESCH), Product Management (PRODMNGT), and Sales Management (SALEMNGT).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Marketing Management)
content: The Third Year of the BSBA Marketing Management program emphasizes entrepreneurship, taxation, and research. The First Semester (21 units) includes Distribution Management (DISTMNGT), Entrepreneurial Management (ENTRMNGT), Franchising (FRANCHIS), Philippine Literature (GEPHILIT), Income Taxation (INCMTAXN), Managerial Accounting (MGRLACCT), and Business Research in Marketing Management/Thesis 1 (MMBUSRS1). The Second Semester (15 units) includes Taxation 2/Business Taxation (BUSITAXN), Ethics (GEETHICS), Business Research in Marketing Mgt./Thesis 2 (MMBUSRS2), Pricing and Costing (PRICSTRA), and Professional Salesmanship (PROFSALE).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Marketing Management)
content: The Fourth Year of the BSBA Marketing Management program concludes with legal and strategic studies followed by an internship. The First Semester (12 units) requires Business Law/Obligations & Contract (BUSLWOBL), International Business and Trade (INTLBATT), Operations Management/TQM (OPTNMNGT), and Strategic Management (STRAMNGT). The Second Semester (6 units) is dedicated entirely to the Marketing Practicum (MKTGPRAC), which requires 600 hours of training and has Business Research in Marketing Mgt. (Thesis 2) as a prerequisite.

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Civil Engineering)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Engineering, offers the Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering (BSCE) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 194 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and one summer term, covering general education, fundamental engineering sciences, and specialized civil engineering disciplines[cite: 234, 278, 279].
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Civil Engineering)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Civil Engineering program at EARIST lays the foundation in mathematics and sciences. [cite_start]The First Semester (29 units) includes Civil Engineering Orientation (CEENG111), Differential Calculus (CENMAT01), Mathematics for Engineers (CENMATH 111), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Chemistry for Engineers (NATSCI SP_102), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1)[cite: 235]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (27 units) includes Computer Fundamentals and Programming (COM_SP_212), Engineering Drawing and Plans (DRW 101A), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Calculus II/Integral Calculus (MATH_104), Physics for Engineers/Calculus Based (NATSCI103A), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2)[cite: 238].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Civil Engineering)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSCE program introduces core engineering mechanics and surveying. [cite_start]The First Semester (25 units) comprises Computer Aided Drafting (CAD 101), Fundamentals of Surveying (CVL 311A), Differential Equations (DIFFEQUA), Engineering Economy (EECO_311), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence and Research Writing (GEADCPBR), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Statics of Rigid Bodies (STRIGBOD)[cite: 244]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (26 units) covers Mechanics of Deformable Bodies (CENMECDB), Construction Materials and Testing (CVENG221), Engineering Data Analysis (CVENG222), Engineering Surveys (CVENG223), Geology for Civil Engineering (CVENG224), Practical Data Science (GEADDPDS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), and Dynamics of Rigid Bodies (MCH 322)[cite: 249].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Civil Engineering)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer OJT
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSCE program focuses on structural theory and specialized engineering fields. [cite_start]The First Semester (25 units) includes Environmental Science and Engineering (CENENVIR), Engineering Utilities 1 (CVENG311), Engineering Utilities 2 (CVENG312), Highway and Railroad Engineering (CVENG313), Numerical Solution to CE Problems (CVENG314), Structural Theory (CVENG315), Engineering Management (CVENG316), and Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT)[cite: 258]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (24 units) covers Technopreneurship (CENTECNO), Building System Design (CVENG321), Hydraulics (CVENG322), Principles of Reinforced/Prestressed Concrete (CVENG323), Principles of Steel Design (CVENG324), Timber Design (CVENG325), and Hydrology (CVENG327)[cite: 260]. [cite_start]The Summer term requires On-the-Job Training (CENOTJOB), which consists of 300 hours and carries 3 credited units[cite: 260].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Civil Engineering)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSCE program includes advanced projects and professional specialization courses. [cite_start]The First Semester (18 units) includes CE Project 1 (CVENG411), Geotechnical Engineering 1/Soil Mechanics (CVENG413), Principles of Transportation Engineering (CVENG414), and three specialized professional courses: Water Resources and Coastal Engineering (CVENGSP1), Earthquake Engineering (CVENGSP2), and Bridge Engineering (CVENGSP3)[cite: 266]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (17 units) concludes with CE Project 2 (CVENG422), Construction Methods and Project Management (CVENG423), Quantity Surveying (CVENG427), specialized courses in Construction Cost Engineering (CVENGSP4) and Foundation Engineering (CVENGSP5), and CE Laws, Ethics and Contracts (CVENG 421)[cite: 269].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Chemical Engineering)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Engineering, offers the Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering (BSChE) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 200 units for completion[cite: 184]. [cite_start]The program structure spans four academic years and one summer term, designed to prepare students with foundational sciences, engineering principles, and specialized technical skills[cite: 137, 139, 140].
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Chemical Engineering)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Chemical Engineering program focuses on general sciences and mathematics. [cite_start]The First Semester (27 units) includes Differential Calculus (CENMAT01), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Chemistry for Engineers (NATSCI SP_102), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1)[cite: 140]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (23 units) advances to Analytical Chemistry (CHE 102), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Calculus II/Integral Calculus (MATH_104), Physics for Engineers/Calculus Based (NATSCI103A), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2)[cite: 143].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Chemical Engineering)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSChE program introduces specialized chemistry and core engineering mechanics. [cite_start]The First Semester (26 units) comprises Organic Chemistry (ALCHE_03A), Chemical Engineering Calculations (CHE0211A), Differential Equations (DIFFEQUA), Engineering Mechanics (EEMCH 211), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), and Engineering Data Analysis (MM16)[cite: 150]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (24 units) includes Physical Chemistry for Engineers 1 (ALCHE_04), Fundamentals of Material Science and Engineering (ALCHE_05), Introduction to Transport Phenomena and Momentum Transfer (CHENG _02), Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics (CHENG_03), Advanced Engineering Math in CHE (CHENG 04), Computer Aided Design (GENCAD 111), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), and Strength of Materials (STROFMAT)[cite: 151].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Chemical Engineering)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer OJT
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSChE program focuses on advanced thermodynamic systems and reaction engineering. [cite_start]The First Semester (27 units) includes Introduction to Biotechnology (ALCHE306), Environmental Science and Engineering (CENENVIR), Heat and Mass Transfer (CHENG306), Physical Chemistry for Engineers 2 (CHENG307), Solution Thermodynamics (CHENG308), Methods of Research (CHENG309), Computer Application in ChE (CHENG310), Electrical Standards and Practices (EEENG411), and Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP)[cite: 160]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (26 units) covers Basic and Inferential Statistics (ALCHE308), Engineering Economy (CENENECO), Chemical Reaction Engineering (CHENG311), Chemical Engineering Lab (CHENG312), Particle Technology (CHENG313), Separation Processes (CHENG314), Chemical Process Industries (CHENG315), Track Specialization 1/Paints and Coatings (CHENG316), and Living in Information Technology Era (GMELECHT)[cite: 163]. [cite_start]The Summer term requires On-the-Job Training (CENOTJOB), consisting of 300 hours for 3 credited units[cite: 163].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Chemical Engineering)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSChE program involves capstone design projects and specialized professional tracks. [cite_start]The First Semester (19 units) includes Chemical Engineering Design 1 (CHENG417), Biochemical Engineering (CHENG418), Chemical Engineering Lab 2 (CHENG419), Chemical Process Lab (CHENG420), Engineering Management (CVENG316), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Ethics (GEETHICS), Process Safety (CHENG421), and Track Specialization 2/Air Pollution (CHENG422)[cite: 167]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (25 units) concludes with Chemical Engineering Laws and Ethics (CHENG423), Chemical Engineering Design 2 (CHENG424), Process Dynamics and Control (CHENG425), Technopreneurship (CENTECNO), Industrial Waste Management and Control (CHENG426), Field Trips and Seminars (CHENG427), Quantitative Methods in Management (CHENG428), Track Specialization 3/Energy Engineering (CHENG429), and Course Integration (CHENG430)[cite: 174].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Computer Engineering)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Engineering, offers the Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering (BSCpE) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 183 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and one summer term, combining electrical engineering fundamentals with computer science and hardware design.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Computer Engineering)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Computer Engineering program establishes the technical and mathematical foundations of the discipline. The First Semester (26 units) includes Computer Aided Drafting (CENCAD 111), Differential Calculus (CENMAT01), Mathematics for Engineers (CENMATH 111), and Computer Engineering as a Discipline (CPENG111). General courses include Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Chemistry for Engineers (NATSCI SP_102), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (27 units) introduces programming with Object Oriented Programming (CPE 112) and Programming Logic and Design (CPE 113). Additional requirements include Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Integral Calculus (MATH_104_5C), Engineering Data Analysis (MATH 122), Physics for Engineers/Calculus Based (NATSCI103A), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Computer Engineering)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSCpE program advances into circuit theory and software algorithms. The First Semester (26 units) comprises Data Structures and Algorithm Analysis (CPENG211), Differential Equations (DIFFEQUA), Fundamentals of Electrical Circuits (EEENG211), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO). The Second Semester (25 units) covers Engineering Economy (CENENECO), Numerical Methods (CPENG221), Software Design (CPENG222), Fundamentals of Electronic Circuits (ECENG221), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), and Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS).

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Computer Engineering)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer OJT
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSCpE program focuses on hardware-software integration and networks. The First Semester (24 units) includes Environmental Science and Engineering (CENENVIR), Cognate/Elective Course 1 (CPEELEC1), Logic Circuits and Design (CPENG311), Data and Digital Communications (CPENG312), CPE Drafting & Design (CPENG313), Operating Systems (CPENG314), Discrete Mathematics (CPENG315), and Fundamentals of Mixed Signal & Sensors (MXSIGSEN). The Second Semester (21 units) includes Technopreneurship (CENTECNO), Cognate/Elective Course 2 (CPEELEC2), Basic Occupational Health & Safety (CPENG321), Computer Network and Security (CPENG322), Microprocessors (CPENG323), CpE Laws and Professional Practice (CPENG324), and Engineering Management (CVENG316). The Summer term requires On-the-Job Training (CENOTJOB), which consists of 300 hours and carries 3 credited units.

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Computer Engineering)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSCpE program is dedicated to capstone design and advanced computer architecture. The First Semester (20 units) includes Methods of Research (CPENG411), Computer Architecture and Organization (CPENG412), Embedded Systems (CPENG413), Emerging Technologies in CpE (CPENG414), CpE Practice and Design 1 (CPENG415), Feedback and Control System (CPENG416), and Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP). The Second Semester (11 units) concludes the degree with Cognate/Elective Course 3 (CPEELEC3), CPE Practice and Design 2 (CPENG421), Digital Signal Processing (CPENG422), Introduction to HDL (CPENG423), and Seminars and Field Trips (CPENG424).

source: EARIST BS Criminology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Criminal Justice Education Curriculum
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Criminal Justice Education, offers the Bachelor of Science in Criminology program[cite: 103, 104, 105]. [cite_start]This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 176 units for completion[cite: 138, 139]. [cite_start]The program provides comprehensive training in law enforcement, criminal law, forensics, and social sciences[cite: 106, 116, 125].

source: EARIST BS Criminology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Criminal Justice Education Curriculum
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Criminology program lays the foundation for understanding crime and society. [cite_start]The First Semester requires 26 credited units, consisting of Introduction to Criminology (C1INTCRI), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Gender and Society (GEELECGS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fundamentals of Martial Arts (GEPEFOMA), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), and NSTP Military Training Service 1 (NSTPMTS1)[cite: 106]. [cite_start]The Second Semester requires 30 credited units, including Human Behavior and Victimology (C2HUMBEV), Introduction to Philippine Criminal Justice System (CLIPCJS), Living in Information Technology Era (GMELECHT), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Arnis and Disarming Techniques (GEPEAADT), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Law Enforcement Organization and Administration (LILAEOAD), and NSTP Military Training Service 2 (NSTPMTS2)[cite: 109].

source: EARIST BS Criminology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Criminal Justice Education Curriculum
content: The Second Year of the BS Criminology program focuses on theories of crime, police operations, and forensic sciences. [cite_start]The First Semester (26 credited units) includes Theories and Causes of Crime (C3THCACR), Professional Conduct and Ethical Standards (C4PECSTA), Forensic Photography (F1FORPHO), General Chemistry (Organic) (GEADCHEM), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Environmental Science (GEELECES), First Aid and Water Safety (GEPEFAWS), Comparative Models in Policing (L2CONOPO), and Law Enforcement Operation and Planning with Crime Mapping (L3LEPCMP)[cite: 116]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (23 credited units) covers Dispute Resolution and Crises/Incidents Management (C5DRCIMA), Fundamentals of Criminal Investigation and Intelligence (CD1FCIN), Technical English 1 Investigative Report Writing and Presentation (CD2IRWP1), Criminal Law Book 1 (CL2CLBO1), Personal Identification Techniques (F2PEIDTE), Forensic Chemistry and Toxicology (F3FOCHTO), and Fundamentals of Marksmanship (GEPEFUMM)[cite: 118].

source: EARIST BS Criminology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Criminal Justice Education Curriculum
content: The Third Year of the BS Criminology program advances into specialized corrections, technical forensics, and legal forms. [cite_start]The First Semester (28 credited units) includes Juvenile Delinquency and Juvenile Justice System (C6JDAJJS), Institutional Corrections (CA1INSCO), Technical English 2 (Legal Forms) (CD3TELF2), Traffic Management and Accident Investigation with Driving (CD4TMAID), Character Formation 1 - Nationalism and Patriotism (CFLMINAP), Criminal Law Book 2 (CL3CLBO2), Questioned Documents Examination (F4QUDOEX), Lie Detection Techniques (F5LIDETE), and Introduction to Industrial Security Concepts (L4INSECO)[cite: 125]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (27 credited units) includes Criminological Research 1 (Research Methods with Applied Statistics) (C7CRIMAS), Non-Institutional Corrections (CA2NOICO), Specialized Crime Investigation 1 with Legal Medicine (CD5SCI1M), Fire Protection and Arson Investigation (CD7FPTAI), Vice and Drug Education and Control (CD8VDEAC), Introduction to Cybercrime and Environmental Laws and Protection (CD9INCYB), Character Formation 2 (CFLM2LDM), Evidence (CL4EVIDE), and Forensic Ballistics (F6FORBAL)[cite: 128].

source: EARIST BS Criminology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Criminal Justice Education Curriculum
content: The Fourth Year of the BS Criminology program is the final academic year, focusing on research completion, court processes, and internship. [cite_start]The First Semester requires 16 credited units, comprising Criminological Research 2 (Thesis Writing and Presentation) (C8CR2TWP), Therapeutic Modalities (CA3THEMO), Specialized Crime Investigation 2 with Simulation in Interrogation and Interview (CD6SCI21), Criminal Procedure and Court Testimony (CL5CPCTE), Human Rights Education (CL6HURIE), and Internship (OJT 1) which consists of 180 hours (CP1IOJT1)[cite: 134]. [cite_start]The curriculum checklist indicates that the Second Semester has no listed courses, as the total unit count of 176 is achieved upon completion of the First Semester of the Fourth Year[cite: 137, 139].

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Computer Science)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Arts and Sciences (CAS), offers the Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (BSCS) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 168 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years, covering foundational computing concepts, software engineering, intelligent systems, and a capstone thesis project.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Computer Science)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Computer Science program establishes the fundamentals of programming and general education. The First Semester (26 units) includes Computer Programming 1/Fundamentals of Programming (FPROGLAB/FPROGLEC), Introduction to Computing (INTROCOMP), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (32 units) advances to Database Management Systems (DBMGTLAB/DBMGTLEC), Discrete Structure 1 (DISSTRU1), and Computer Programming 2/Intermediate Programming (IPROGLAB/IPROGLEC). Additional requirements include Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Computer Science)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSCS program focuses on algorithms, digital logic, and networking. The First Semester (20 units) comprises Digital Logic Design (DIGDELAB/DIGDELEC), Discrete Structure 2 (DISSTRU2), Data Structures and Algorithm (DSALGLAB/DSALGLEC), Object-Oriented Programming (OOPRGLAB/OOPRGLEC), Physics for Computer Scientists (PHYCSLAB/PHYCSLEC), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), and Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1). The Second Semester (18 units) covers Differential and Integral Calculus (CALCULUS), Graphics and Visual Computing (GPXVCLAB/GPXVCLEC), Information Management (INFOMGMT), Microprocessor & Introduction to Robotics (MICROBOT), Networks and Communications (NETCOMMS), Programming Language (PROGLLAB/PROGLLEC), and Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2).

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Computer Science)
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSCS program introduces advanced computing theory and software engineering. The First Semester (19 units) includes Algorithm and Complexity (ALGCMPLX), Application Development and Emerging Technology (APDEVLAB/APDEVLEC), Architecture and Organization (ARCHIORG), Human Computer Interaction (HUCOMINT), Intelligent Systems (INTELSYS), Operating System (OPERSYST), and Software Engineering 1 (SOFTENG1). The Second Semester (18 units) initiates the research phase with Thesis 1 (CSTHESI1). Other courses include Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Mobile Application Development (MOBAPLAB/MOBAPLEC), Modeling and Simulation (MOSIMLAB/MOSIMLEC), Parallel and Distributed Computing (PARACOMP), and Software Engineering 2 (SOFENGLA/SOFTENG2).

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Computer Science)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSCS program concludes the degree with advanced theory, final thesis defense, and industry immersion. The First Semester (20 units) includes Automata Theory and Formal Language (AUTOMATA), Thesis 2 Lecture and Laboratory (CSTHESI2/CSTHESL2), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Environmental Science (GEELECES), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Information Assurance and Security (INFOASEC), and Social Issues and Professional Practice (SSUPPRAC). The Second Semester (15 units) is dedicated to Practicum/Internship (CSINTERN) which carries 6 units, Ethics (GEETHICS), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), and Industry Observation & Field Trips (INDOBSFT).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Filipino)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Education, offers the Bachelor of Secondary Education (BSE) program with a major in Filipino. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 185 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and focuses on Filipino linguistics, literature, and pedagogical skills.

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Filipino)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSE Filipino program establishes foundations in language and general education. The First Semester (32 units) includes Introduksyon sa Pag-aaral ng Wika (FILINPWK), Ang Filipino sa Kurikulum ng Batayang Edukasyon (FILKRKLM), Panimulang Linggwistika (FILPANLG), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science and Technology (GESCIENTS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 1 (NSTPLTS1), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (32 units) includes Estruktura ng Wikang Filipino (FILESWKF), Pagturo at Pagtataya ng Makrong Kasanayan Pangwika (FILPPMKP), Living in Information Technology Era (GEMELECHT), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Panitikang Rehiyon (LITPANRE), NSTP Literacy Training Service 2 (NSTPLTS2), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Filipino)
content: The Second Year of the BSE Filipino program focuses on instructional materials, culture, and professional education. The First Semester (26 units) comprises Paghahanda at Ebalwasyon ng Kagamitang Panturo (FILPGEBA), Ugnayan ng Wika, Kultura at Lipunan (FILUWKAL), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence and Research Writing (GEADCPBR), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Kulturang Popular (LITKUPOP), The Child and Adolescent Learners and Learning Principles (PEDCALLP), and The Teaching Profession (PEDITPRO). The Second Semester (26 units) covers Masining na Talakayan (FILMASTL), Practical Data Science (GEADDPS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Maikling Kuwento at Nobelang Filipino (LITMKNBF), Sanaysay at Talumpati (LITSANTA), Panunuring Pampanitikan (LITSURIP), The Teacher and the Community, School Culture, and Organizational Leadership (PEDTCSOL), and Technology for Teaching and Learning 1 (PEDTFTAL).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Filipino)
content: The Third Year of the BSE Filipino program advances into specialized language discourse, translation, and research. The First Semester (27 units) includes Barayti at Baryasyon ng Wika (FILBBWKA), Introduksyon sa Pamamahayag (FILHAYAG), Mga Natatanging Diskurso sa Wika at Panitikan (FILNDWKP), Introduksyon sa Pagsasalin (FILSALIN), Introduksyon sa Pananaliksik-Wika at Panitikan (FILSPWKP), Technology for Teaching and Learning 2/Filipino (FILTCHLR), Assessment of Learning 1 (PEDASOL1), Facilitating Learner-Centered Teaching (PEDFALCT), and Foundation of Special and Inclusive Education (PEDFOSIE). The Second Semester (24 units) covers Filipino Para sa Natanging Gamit (ELECFIGM), Filipino bilang Ikalawang Wika (ELECFIWK), Pananaliksik sa Wika at Panitikan (ELECWKPN), Dulang Filipino (LITDULAF), Panulaang Filipino (LITULAFL), Assessment of Learning 2 (PEDASOL2), Building and Enhancing New Literacies Across the Curriculum (PEDBELAC), and The Teacher and The School Curriculum (PEDTSCUR).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Filipino)
content: The Fourth Year of the BSE Filipino program is dedicated to field study and teaching internship. The First Semester (12 units) includes Paghahanda sa Iba't Ibang Kasanayan (ELECPIIK), Competencies Enhancement Program (PEDCOPRO), Field Study 1 (PEDFSTDY1), and Field Study 2 (PEDFSTDY2). The Second Semester (6 units) consists entirely of the Teaching Internship (PEDNTERN).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Mathematics)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Education, offers the Bachelor of Secondary Education (BSE) program with a major in Mathematics. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 177 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and covers advanced mathematical theories, pedagogical strategies, and practical teaching experiences.

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Mathematics)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSE Mathematics program establishes the mathematical foundation and general education requirements. The First Semester (29 units) includes College and Advanced Algebra (MATHCADA), History of Mathematics (MATHHIMA), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 1 (NSTPLTS1), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (32 units) includes Logic and Set Theory (MATHLOGC), Plane and Solid Geometry (MATHPSGE), Trigonometry (MATHTRIG), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 2 (NSTPLTS2), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Mathematics)
content: The Second Year of the BSE Mathematics program introduces calculus, statistics, and professional education courses. The First Semester (27 units) comprises Calculus 1 with Analytic Geometry (MATHCAG1), Elementary Statistics and Probability (MATHESPR), Mathematics of Investment (MATHINVT), Modern Geometry (MATHMODG), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEADCPBR), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), The Child and Adolescent Learners and Learning Principles (PEDCALLP), and The Teaching Profession (PEDTTPRO). The Second Semester (28 units) covers Calculus 2 (MATHANA2), Linear Algebra (MATHLINA), Number Theory (MATHNUMT), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), The Teacher and the Community/School Culture (PEDTCSOL), and Technology for Teaching and Learning 1 (PEDTFTAL).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Mathematics)
content: The Third Year of the BSE Mathematics program focuses on advanced mathematical analysis, research, and teaching strategies. The First Semester (25 units) includes Advance Statistics (MATHADST), Calculus 3 (MATHCAG3), Principles and Strategies of Teaching Mathematics (MATHPSTM), Research in Mathematics (MATHRESM), Solid Mensuration (MATHSOME), Assessment of Learning 1 (PEDASOL1), Facilitating Learner-Centered Teaching (PEDFALCT), and Foundation of Special and Inclusive Education (PEDFOSIE). The Second Semester (21 units) covers Abstract Algebra (MATHABSA), Assessment and Evaluation in Mathematics (MATHAEMA), Problem Solving, Mathematical Investigation and Modelling (MATHPSMI), Technology for Teaching and Learning 2/Instrumentation in Mathematics (MATHTFTL), Assessment of Learning 2 (PEDASOL2), Building and Enhancing New Literacies Across the Curriculum (PEDBELAC), and The Teacher and The School Curriculum (PEDTSCUR).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Mathematics)
content: The Fourth Year of the BSE Mathematics program is dedicated to field study and professional practice. The First Semester (9 units) includes Competencies Enhancement Program (PEDCOPRO), Field Study 1 (PEDFSTDY1), and Field Study 2 (PEDFSTDY2). The Second Semester (6 units) consists entirely of the Teaching Internship (PEDNTERN).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Science)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Education, offers the Bachelor of Secondary Education (BSE) program with a major in Science. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 183 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and covers specialized sciences including astronomy, biology, chemistry, and physics, alongside professional education courses.

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Science)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSE Science program establishes the scientific and general education foundations. The First Semester (29 units) includes Astronomy (ASTRONMY), Earth Science (EARTHSCI), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 1 (NSTPLTS1), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (29 units) includes Environmental Science (ENVISCIE), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Meteorology (METORLGY), NSTP Literacy Training Service 2 (NSTPLTS2), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Science)
content: The Second Year of the BSE Science program advances into biology, chemistry, and physics. The First Semester (29 units) comprises Cell and Molecular Biology (CELLMBIO), Fluid Mechanics (FLUIDMEC), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEADCPBR), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Inorganic Chemistry (INORGCHM), The Child and Adolescent Learners and Learning Principles (PEDCALLP), and The Teaching Profession (PEDTTPRO). The Second Semester (27 units) covers Analytical Chemistry (ANALCHEM), Practical Data Science (GEADDPDS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Genetics (GENESCIE), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), The Teacher and the Community/School Culture (PEDTCSOL), Technology for Teaching and Learning 1 (PEDTFTAL), and Thermodynamics (THERMODY).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Science)
content: The Third Year of the BSE Science program focuses on advanced physics, organic chemistry, and pedagogy. The First Semester (25 units) includes Electricity and Magnetism (ELECMAGN), Microbiology and Parasitology (MICROPRA), Organic Chemistry (ORGACHEM), Assessment of Learning 1 (PEDASOL1), Facilitating Learner-Centered Teaching (PEDFALCT), Foundation of Special and Inclusive Education (PEDFOSIE), and Technology for Teaching and Learning Science 2 (TECTLSCI). The Second Semester (29 units) covers Anatomy and Physiology (ANPHYSIO), Biochemistry (BIOCHEMI), Modern Physics (MODRNPHY), Assessment of Learning 2 (PEDASOL2), Building and Enhancing New Literacies Across the Curriculum (PEDBELAC), The Teacher and The School Curriculum (PEDTSCUR), Research in Teaching Science (RSRCHSCI), The Teaching of Science (TEACHSCI), and Waves & Optics (WAVESOPT).

category: College of Education Curriculum (BSE Science)
content: The Fourth Year of the BSE Science program is dedicated to field study and teaching internship. The First Semester (9 units) includes Competencies Enhancement Program (PEDCOPRO), Field Study 1 (PEDFSTDY1), and Field Study 2 (PEDFSTDY2). The Second Semester (6 units) consists entirely of the Teaching Internship (PEDNTERN).

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electronics and Communication Engineering)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Engineering, offers the Bachelor of Science in Electronics and Communication Engineering (BSECE) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 198 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and one summer term, designed to provide comprehensive training in electronics, communications, and engineering technologies.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Electronics and Communication Engineering

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electronics and Communication Engineering)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSECE program lays the mathematical and scientific foundation for engineering. The First Semester (28 units) includes Computer Aided Drafting (CENCAD 111), Differential Calculus (CENMAT01), Mathematics for Engineers (CENMATH 111), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Chemistry for Engineers (NATSCI SP_102), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (29 units) includes Environmental Science and Engineering (CENENVIR), Physics 2 (CENPHY2), ECE Workshop 1 (ECE 110L1), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Calculus II/Integral Calculus (MATH 104), Physics for Engineers/Calculus Based (NATSCI103A), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electronics and Communication Engineering)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSECE program focuses on core electronics and electrical circuits. The First Semester (26 units) comprises Material Science and Engineering (CENMSE), Computer Programming (CENPROG), Differential Equations (DIFFEQUA), Electronics 1: Electronics Devices and Circuits (ECENG211), Engineering Economy (EECO 311), Electrical Circuits 1 (EEENG 211), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEADCPBR), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Engineering Data Analysis (MM16). The Second Semester (28 units) covers Engineering Management (CVENG316), Electronics 2: Electronic Circuit Analysis and Design (ECENG221B), Communications 1: Principles of Communication System (ECENG222), Electrical Circuits 2 (EEENG 221), Electromagnetics (EEN 323), Practical Data Science (GEADDPDS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), and Advance Engineering Mathematics for ECE (MATH319B).

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electronics and Communication Engineering)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer OJT
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSECE program advances into systems design, digital electronics, and signal processing. The First Semester (25 units) includes Electronics 3: Electronic Systems and Design (ECENG311), Digital Electronics 1: Logic Circuits and Switching Theory (ECENG312), Signals, Spectra, and Signal Processing (ECENG313), Communications 2: Modulation and Coding Techniques (ECENG314), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Ethics (GEETHICS), and The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR). The Second Semester (22 units) covers Communication 3: Transmission Media, Antenna System and Design (ECENG 321), Communications 4: Data Communications (ECENG322), Digital Electronics 2: Microprocessor & Microcontroller Systems & Design (ECENG323), Feedback and Control Systems (ECENG324), ECE Laws, Contracts, Ethics, Standards & Safety (ECENG325), and Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO). The Summer term requires On-the-Job Training (CENOTJOB), which consists of 300 hours and carries 3 credited units.

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electronics and Communication Engineering)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSECE program is dedicated to capstone design, research, and specialized electives. The First Semester (21 units) includes Technopreneurship (CENTECNO), Methods of Research (ECENG411), ECE Elective 1/Advanced Communication System and Design (ECENG412), ECE Elective 2/Advanced Power Supply Systems (ECENG413), ECE Elective 3/Advanced Instrumentation & Control Systems (ECENG414), Design 1/Capstone Project (ECENG415), and Review 1/Mathematics & GEAS (ECENG416). The Second Semester (16 units) concludes the degree with Seminars/Colloquium (ECENG421), Design 2/Capstone Project 2 (ECENG422), ECE Elective 4/Advanced Networking (ECENG423), ECE Elective 5/Renewable Energy Systems (ECENG424), ECE Elective 6/Robotics Technology (ECENG425), and Review 2/Electronics & Communications/EST (ECENG426).

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electrical Engineering)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Engineering, offers the Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering (BSEE) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 196 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and one summer term, providing comprehensive training in electrical circuits, power systems, electronics, and engineering standards[cite: 541, 542, 508].
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electrical Engineering)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSEE program establishes the fundamental engineering sciences and mathematics. [cite_start]The First Semester (25 units) includes Computer Aided Drafting (CENCAD 111), Differential Calculus (CENMAT01), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Chemistry for Engineers (NATSCI_SP_102), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1)[cite: 500]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (27 units) includes Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Calculus II/Integral Calculus (MATH_104), Physics for Engineers/Calculus Based (NATSCI103A), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2)[cite: 503].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electrical Engineering)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSEE program focuses on core electrical and mechanical engineering principles. [cite_start]The First Semester (27 units) comprises Computer Programming (CENPROG), Differential Equations (DIFFEQUA), Electrical Circuits 1 (EEENG_211), Engineering Mechanics (EEMCH 211), Basic Thermodynamics (EEMEN 211), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Engineering Data Analysis (MM16)[cite: 509]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (22 units) covers Electronics Circuits: Devices and Analysis (ECENG 221), Electrical Circuits 2 (EEENG 221), Engineering Math for EE (EEENG 222), Electromagnetics (EEENG_223), Fundamentals of Deformable Bodies (EEMCH 221), Fluid Mechanics (EEMCH 222), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), and Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2)[cite: 512].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electrical Engineering)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer OJT
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSEE program advances into power systems, machinery, and specialized electronics. [cite_start]The First Semester (22 units) includes Engineering Economy (CENENECO), Electrical Circuits 3/Polyphase (EEENG311), Numerical Methods and Analysis (EEENG312), Electrical Machines 1 (EEENG313), Fundamentals of Electronics Communication (EEFUNECO), Industrial Electronics (EEINELEC), and Logic Circuit and Switching Theory (EELOGCKT)[cite: 520]. The Second Semester (27 units) includes Environmental Science and Engineering (CENENVIR), Microprocessor System (ECENG321), EE Laws, Codes and Professional Ethics (EEENG321), Electrical Machines 2 (EEENG322), Electrical Apparatus and Devices (EEENG323), Basic Occupational Safety and Health (EEENG324), Feedback Control Systems (EEENG325), and Management of Engineering Projects and Estimate (EEENG326). [cite_start]The Summer term requires On-the-Job Training (CENOTJOB), which consists of 300 hours and carries 3 credited units[cite: 522].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Electrical Engineering)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSEE program involves advanced design, research, and professional preparation. The First Semester (26 units) includes Material Science and Engineering (CENMATSC), Technopreneurship (CENTECNO), Electrical Standards and Practices (EEENG411), Electrical Systems and Illumination Design (EEENG412), EE Elective 1/Power System Protection 1 (EEENG413), Research Methods (EEENG414), Instrumentation and Control (EEENG415), Review 1/ESAS & Mathematics (EEENG416), Adv. [cite_start]AutoCAD for EE (EEENG417), and The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR)[cite: 529]. [cite_start]The Second Semester (17 units) concludes the degree with Power System Analysis (EEENG421), EE Elective 2/Power System Protection 2 (EEENG422), Research Project or Capstone Design Project (EEENG423), Seminars/Field Trip/Colloquia (EEENG424), Fundamentals of Power Plant Design (EEENG425), Distribution Systems and Substation Design (EEENG426), and Review 2/Electrical Engineering (EEENG427)[cite: 532].

source: EARIST BS Entrepreneurship Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Entrepreneurship)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Business and Public Administration (CBPA), offers the Bachelor of Science in Entrepreneurship program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 129 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and focuses on opportunity seeking, business planning, and enterprise implementation.

source: EARIST BS Entrepreneurship Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Entrepreneurship)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Entrepreneurship program establishes the foundation for business creation. The First Semester (20 units) includes Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Human Resource Management (HURSMNGT), Microeconomics (MICROECO), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), and Opportunity Seeking (OPPOSEEK). The Second Semester (26 units) includes Entrepreneurial Behavior (ENBEHAVE), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2), and Social Entrepreneurship (SOCIALEN).

source: EARIST BS Entrepreneurship Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Entrepreneurship)
content: The Second Year of the BS Entrepreneurship program focuses on business laws, planning, and strategic management. The First Semester (20 units) comprises Business Law and Taxation (BUSLWTXN), Business Plan Preparation (BUSPLNPR), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Ethics (GEETHICS), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Market Research and Consumer Behavior (MKTRESCH). The Second Semester (20 units) covers The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Operations Management/TQM (OPTNMNGT), Program and Policies on Enterprise Development (PRGPOLED), Pricing and Costing (PRICSTRA), and Strategic Management (STRAMNGT).

source: EARIST BS Entrepreneurship Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Entrepreneurship)
content: The Third Year of the BS Entrepreneurship program emphasizes specialized tracks such as manufacturing, service, and agribusiness. The First Semester (18 units) includes E-commerce (ECOMMERC), Entrepreneurial Marketing Strategies (ENTMKSTR), Events Management (EVNTMNGT), Financial Management (FINLMNGT), International Business and Trade (INTLBATT), and Manufacturing (MFGTRAC1). The Second Semester (15 units) covers Agribusiness (AGRTRAC3), Distribution Management (DISTMNGT), Franchising (FRANCHIS), Innovation Management (INNOMNGT), and Managing a Service Enterprise (MSETRAC2).

source: EARIST BS Entrepreneurship Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Entrepreneurship)
content: The Fourth Year of the BS Entrepreneurship program is dedicated entirely to the practical execution of business plans. The First Semester (5 units) consists of Business Plan Implementation I (BUSPLAN1). The Second Semester (5 units) concludes the degree with Business Plan Implementation II (BUSPLAN2). Both courses require the prior completion of Business Plan Preparation.

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Hospitality and Tourism Management (CHTM), offers the Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management (BSHM) program. The curriculum is structured to provide students with theoretical knowledge and practical skills in lodging, food service, and tourism operations over the course of four academic years.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSHM program lays the foundation for general education and core hospitality concepts. The First Semester (23 units) includes Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), Macro Perspective of Tourism and Hospitality (THCMACPR), and Risk Management as Applied to Safety, Security and Sanitation (THCRISKM). The Second Semester (38 units) includes Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Fundamentals in Lodging Operations (HPCFUNLO), Kitchen Essentials and Basic Food Preparation (HPCKITES), NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2), Micro Perspective of Tourism and Hospitality (THCMICPR), and Quality Service Management in Tourism and Hospitality (THCQUASM).

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum
content: The Second Year of the BSHM program focuses on operations management, culinary arts, and legal aspects of the industry. The First Semester (23 units) comprises Operations Management in Tourism and Hospitality (BMECOPMN), World Literature and Humanities (GEADWOLH), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Commercial Baking with Entrepreneurship (HMPECBWE), Fundamentals in Food Service Operations (HPCFUNFS), Philippine Culture and Tourism Geography (THCPHCTG), and Applied Business Tools and Technologies (THPCABTT). The Second Semester (23 units) includes Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Asian Cuisine (HMPEASCU), Bar and Beverage Management with Laboratory (HMPEBARM), Rooms Division (HMPERDIV), Entrepreneurship in Tourism and Hospitality (THCENTRE), Legal Aspects in Tourism and Hospitality (THCLEGAS), Tourism and Hospitality Marketing (THCMARKT), and Professional Development and Applied Ethics (THCPDAET).

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum
content: The Third Year of the BSHM program emphasizes strategic management, specialized cuisine, and research. The First Semester (24 units) includes Strategic Management and Total Quality Management (BMECSTQM), Introduction to MICE Management (THPCMICE), Foreign Language 1 (THPCFLA1), Food and Beverage Operations with Laboratory (HMPEFBOP), Research in Hospitality 1 (HPCRESH1), Western Cuisine (HMPEWECU), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), and Practical Data Science (GEELECDS). The Second Semester (24 units) covers Cruiseship Operations and Management (HMPECROM), Ergonomics and Facilities Planning (HPCERGFP), Garde Manger with Food Styling and Design (HMPEGMFD), Research in Hospitality 2 (HPCRESH2), Cost Control in Hospitality Industry (HMPECCHI), Catering and Banquet Management (HMPECABM), Foreign Language 2 (THPCFLA2), and Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH).

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum
content: The Fourth Year of the BSHM program concludes with advanced topics and industry immersion. The First Semester (15 units) includes Ethics (GEETHICS), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Advanced Bread and Pastry Production (HMPEADBP), Supply Chain Management in Hospitality Industry (HPCSUPCM), and Multicultural Diversity in Workplace for the Tourism Professional (THCMULDI). The Second Semester is dedicated entirely to the Hospitality Practicum (HPCHOSPR), which requires 600 hours of training in Hotel, Restaurant, Event Centers, or Resorts. This practicum has extensive prerequisites involving nearly all major subjects from the previous three years.

source: EARIST BS Interior Design Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Interior Design)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Architecture and Fine Arts (CAFA), offers the Bachelor of Science in Interior Design (BSID) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 186 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and one summer term, covering design theory, history, technical skills, and professional practice.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Interior Design

source: EARIST BS Interior Design Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Interior Design)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Interior Design program establishes the foundation in design basics and general education. The First Semester (27 units) includes Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Interior Design 1A (INDES111), Interior Design Drafting (INDESIDD), Theory of Interior Design (INDESTID), Visual Techniques (INDESVST), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (28 units) includes The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Interior Design 1B (INDES121), Color Studies 1/Color Theory (INDESCTH), History of Philippine Art (INDESHPA), Perspective (INDESPER), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

source: EARIST BS Interior Design Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Interior Design)
content: The Second Year of the BS Interior Design program focuses on rendering, history, and materials. The First Semester (27 units) comprises 2-Dimensional Drawing (2DDRAWNG), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Sinesosyedad/Pelikulang Panlipunan (GESINEPP), Interior Design 2A (INDES211), Color Studies II/Color Rendering (INDESCRD), History of Interior Design 1 (INDESHD1), and Materials and Resources 1 (INDESMR1). The Second Semester (27 units) covers 3-Dimensional Drawing (3DDRAWNG), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Interior Design 2B (INDES221), Renaissance Art (INDES223), History of Interior Design 2 (INDESHD2), Lighting Design (INDESLID), and Materials and Resources 2 (INDESMR2).

source: EARIST BS Interior Design Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Interior Design)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer Internship
content: The Third Year of the BS Interior Design program emphasizes furniture design, construction utilities, and research. The First Semester (24 units) includes Computer Rendering (COMRENDG), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Interior Design 3A (INDES311), Construction Materials and Utilities (INDESCMU), Furniture Design 1 (INDESFD1), and History of Interior Design 3/Oriental Arts (INDESHD3). The Second Semester (26 units) covers Costume and Fashion (FASHNDES), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Interior Design 3B (INDES321), Building Utilities/ID Elec 5 (INDESBUT), Furniture Design 2 (INDESFD2), Interior Construction and Detailing (INDESICD), Plant/Cultural Tours and Seminars (INDESPCT), and Research Methods in Interior Design (INDESRID). The Summer term requires Practicum/Internship (INDESPRAC) consisting of 3 credited units.

source: EARIST BS Interior Design Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Architecture and Fine Arts Curriculum (Interior Design)
