content: The Fourth Year of the BS Interior Design program concludes the degree with thesis work and professional practice. The First Semester (12 units) includes Interior Design 7/Thesis/Research (INDES411), Business Management in Interior Design (INDESBMD), and Interior Floral Design and Plantscaping (INDESIFP). The Second Semester (12 units) covers Interior Design 8/Actual Construction (INDES421), Interior Styling and Photography (INDESISP), and Professional Practice and Ethics (INDESPPE).

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Information Technology)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Arts and Sciences (CAS), offers the Bachelor of Science in Information Technology (BSIT) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 157 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years, focusing on software development, networking, database management, and systems administration.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Information Technology)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Information Technology program establishes the foundations of computing and general education. The First Semester (26 units) includes Computer Programming 1/Fundamentals of Programming (FPROGLAB/FPROGLEC), Introduction to Computing (INTCOMLB/INTCOMLC), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (33 units) advances to Database Management System 1 (DBMSLAB1/DBMSLEC1), Discrete Mathematics (DISCMATH), Computer Programming 2/Intermediate Programming (IPROGLAB/IPROGLEC), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Information Technology)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSIT program covers core technical skills in web development, networking, and databases. The First Semester (11 units) includes Business Analytics (BUSANALY), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Web Development 1 (WEBDVLB1/WEBDVLC1). The Second Semester (20 units) includes Database Management System 2 (DBMSLAB2/DBMSLEC2), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Introduction to Human Computer Interaction (INTHCILB/INTHCILC), Integrative Programming and Technologies 1 (IPATLAB1/IPATLEC1), Networking 1 (NETWKLB1/NETWKLC1), and Web Development 2 (WEBDVLB2/WEBDVLC2).

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Information Technology)
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSIT program focuses on advanced systems, mobile development, and research. The First Semester (18 units) includes Application Development and Emerging Technology (APDEVLAB/APDEVLEC), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Multimedia (MMDIALAB/MMDIALEC), Networking 2 (NETWKLB2/NETWKLC2), Systems Integration and Architecture 1 (SYSARCH1/SYSARLB1), and Web Development 3 (WEBDVLB3/WEBDVLC3). The Second Semester (21 units) initiates the research phase with Capstone Project and Research 1 (ITTHESI1). Other courses include Environmental Science (GEELECES), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Information Assurance and Security 1 (IAASLAB1/IAASLEC1), Mobile Application Development (MOBAPLAB/MOBAPLEC), Object-Oriented Programming (OOPRGLAB/OOPRGLEC), and Quantitative Methods (QUANMETH).

category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Information Technology)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSIT program concludes with advanced security, systems administration, and industry immersion. The First Semester (18 units) includes The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Information Assurance and Security 2 (IAASLAB2/IAASLEC2), Capstone Project and Research 2 (ITTHESI2/ITTHESL2), Social and Professional Issues (SPISSUES), Systems Administration and Maintenance (SYSADMLB/SYSADMLC), and Systems Integration and Architecture 2 (SYSARCH2/SYSARLB2). The Second Semester (10 units) is dedicated entirely to the Practicum/Internship (ITINTERN).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Automotive Technology)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Industrial Technology (CIT), offers the Bachelor of Science in Industrial Technology program specializing in Automotive Technology. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 168 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years, covering general education, technical automotive skills, welding, electronics, and intensive industrial training.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Industrial Technology

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Automotive Technology)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Industrial Technology (Automotive Technology) program establishes fundamental technical and general skills. The First Semester (23 units) includes Basic SMAW and GMAW, Soldering and Joining Operation for Automotive Application (AUTOTEC1), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Industrial Drawing with CAD 1/2D (INDRACA1), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (29 units) includes Automotive Engine Overhauling, Rebuilding, Basic Power Conversion and Electrical Assembly (AUTOTEC2), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Industrial Drawing with CAD 2/3D (INDRACA2), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Automotive Technology)
content: The Second Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Automotive Technology) program focuses on specialized automotive systems and electronics. The First Semester (23 units) comprises Automotive Air-conditioning System: Servicing, Repair and Maintenance (AUTOTEC3), Basic Automotive Electronics Engine Management System (ELCAUTO1), Entrepreneurship and Cooperatives (ENTNCOOP), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Plant Visit and Seminar (PLAVISEM). The Second Semester (23 units) covers Motorcycle and Small Engine Servicing and Maintenance (AUTOTEC4), Computer Programming (COMPPROG), Automotive Electronic Instrumentation & Electronic Climate Control Systems Servicing and Maintenance (ELCAUTO2), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), and Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Automotive Technology)
content: The Third Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Automotive Technology) program advances into electronic management and research. The First Semester (24 units) includes Advanced Electronic Engine Management for Petrol/Gasoline Engine (AUTOTEC5), Automotive Body Computer System Diagnosis and Electronically Controlled Powertrain System (ELCAUTO3), Foreign Language (FORELANG), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Industrial Organization & Management (INDORMAN), and Methodology of Research 1/Feasibility Study (METORES1). The Second Semester (24 units) covers Advanced Electronic Engine Management for Common Rail Direct Injection Diesel Engine (AUTOTEC6), Elective 4: Simulated Safety Driving and Troubleshooting (ELCAUTO4), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Labor Relation (LABRELTN), Methodology of Research 2/Project Study (METORES2), Occupational Health and Safety Standards (OHASSTAN), and Production Operation Management (PROOPMAN).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Automotive Technology)
topic: Fourth Year Coursework and Industrial Training
content: The Fourth Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Automotive Technology) program consists entirely of intensive industrial training. The First Semester (11 units) requires In-Plant Training (INPLTRN1) and Student Training Evaluation 1 (STTREVL). The Second Semester (11 units) requires Supervised Industrial Training (INPLTRN2) and Student Training Evaluation 2 (STTREVL2).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Drafting Technology)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Industrial Technology (CIT), offers the Bachelor of Science in Industrial Technology program specializing in Drafting Technology. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 162 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years, focusing on manual and computer-aided drafting (CAD), architectural rendering, modeling, and intensive industrial training.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Industrial Technology

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Drafting Technology)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Industrial Technology (Drafting Technology) program establishes foundational drafting skills. The First Semester (23 units) includes Advanced Mechanical Drafting (DRAFTEC1), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURCO), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Industrial Drawing with CAD 1/2D (INDRACA1), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (23 units) includes Advance Machine and Furniture Drafting (DRAFTEC2), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Industrial Drawing with CAD 2/3D (INDRACA2), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Drafting Technology)
content: The Second Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Drafting Technology) program focuses on architectural drafting and specialized CAD software. The First Semester (23 units) comprises Advanced Architectural Drafting 1 (DRAFTEC3), Auto CAD Drawing (ELCDRAF1), Entrepreneurship and Cooperatives (ENTNCOOP), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Plant Visit and Seminar (PLAVISEM). The Second Semester (23 units) covers Computer Programming (COMPPROG), Advanced Architectural Drafting 2 (DRAFTEC4), Sketch-up with Vray (ELCDRAF2), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), and Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Drafting Technology)
content: The Third Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Drafting Technology) program advances into 3D modeling, rendering, and research. The First Semester (24 units) includes CAD Architectural Renderings (DRAFTEC5), Revit Architecture (ELCDRAF3), Foreign Language (FORELANG), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Industrial Organization & Management (INDORMAN), and Methodology of Research 1/Feasibility Study (METORES1). The Second Semester (24 units) covers 3D Architectural Modeling and Construction Materials and Estimate (DRAFTEC6), Elective 4: Photoshop (ELCDRAF4), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Labor Relation (LABRELTN), Methodology of Research 2/Project Study (METORES2), Occupational Health and Safety Standards (OHASSTAN), and Production Operation Management (PROOPMAN).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Drafting Technology)
topic: Fourth Year Coursework and Industrial Training
content: The Fourth Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Drafting Technology) program consists entirely of intensive industrial training. The First Semester (11 units) requires In-Plant Training (INPLTRN1) and Student Training Evaluation 1 (STTREVL). The Second Semester (11 units) requires Supervised Industrial Training (INPLTRN2) and Student Training Evaluation 2 (STTREVL2).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Electrical Technology)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Industrial Technology (CIT), offers the Bachelor of Science in Industrial Technology program specializing in Electrical Technology. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 162 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years, focusing on electrical codes, motor controls, automation, and industrial training.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Industrial Technology

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Electrical Technology)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Industrial Technology (Electrical Technology) program establishes fundamental electrical skills and general education. The First Semester (23 units) includes Philippine Electrical Code (PEC) and Its Application (ELECTRI1), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURCO), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Industrial Drawing with CAD 1/2D (INDRACA1), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (23 units) includes Transformer, DC Rotating Machine and Alternative Sources of Energy (ELECTRI2), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Industrial Drawing with CAD 2/3D (INDRACA2), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Electrical Technology)
content: The Second Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Electrical Technology) program focuses on motors, refrigeration, and electronics. The First Semester (23 units) comprises Domestic Refrigeration and Air-conditioning System (ELCELCT1), AC Rotating Machine, Single Phase and Three Phase Motors (ELECTRI3), Entrepreneurship and Cooperatives (ENTNCOOP), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), and Plant Visit and Seminar (PLAVISEM). The Second Semester (23 units) covers Computer Programming (COMPPROG), Basic Electronics (ELCELCT2), Basic Motor Control Circuits (ELECTRI4), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), and Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2).

category: College of Industrial Technology Curriculum (Electrical Technology)
content: The Third Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Electrical Technology) program advances into automation, logic circuits, and research. The First Semester (24 units) includes Logic Circuit and Solid State Motor Controller (ELCELCT3), Advanced Motor Control Circuits (ELECTRI5), Foreign Language (FORELANG), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Industrial Organization & Management (INDORMAN), and Methodology of Research 1/Feasibility Study (METORES1). content: The Third Year of the BS Industrial Technology (Refrigeration and Air Conditioning) program advances into industrial heating, chillers, and research. source: EARIST BS Mathematics Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Mathematics)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Arts and Sciences (CAS), offers the Bachelor of Science in Mathematics (BS Math) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 182 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and concludes with a practicum/internship component[cite: 88, 92, 125].

source: EARIST BS Mathematics Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Mathematics)
content: The First Year curriculum for the Bachelor of Science in Mathematics at EARIST consists of foundational courses and general education requirements. The First Semester (34 units) includes Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Calculus 1 (MATHANA1), Fundamental Concepts of Mathematics (MATHFUND), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). [cite_start]The Second Semester (32 units) introduces computing and physics, requiring Fundamentals of Computing 1 (COMPLAB1/COMPLEC1), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), General Physics 1/Mechanics and Heat (GPMAHLAB/GPMAHLEC), Calculus 2 (MATHANA2), and National Service Training Program 2 (NSTPROG2)[cite: 93, 96].

source: EARIST BS Mathematics Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Mathematics)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BS Mathematics program advances into higher calculus and abstract mathematics. The First Semester (21 units) comprises Fundamentals of Computing 2 (COMPLAB2/COMPLEC2), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), General Physics 2/Electricity and Magnetism (GPEAMLAB/GPEAMLEC), Abstract Algebra (MATHABSA), and Calculus 3 (MATHANA3). [cite_start]The Second Semester (23 units) includes Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Advanced Calculus (MATHADVC), Linear Algebra (MATHLINA), and Probability (MATHPROB)[cite: 102, 105].

source: EARIST BS Mathematics Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Mathematics)
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BS Mathematics program focuses on specialized mathematical theories and applications. The First Semester (24 units) includes Automata Theory and Formal Language (AUTOMATA), Differential Equations (DIFFEQUA), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Graph Theory and Applications (MATHGRAP), Theory of Interest (MATHINTE), Number Theory (MATHNUMT), Statistical Theory (MATHSTAT), and Operations Research (OPERSRES). [cite_start]The Second Semester (21 units) covers The Entrepreneurial Mind (GEELECEM), Actuarial Mathematics (MATHACTU), Mathematical Modeling (MATHMODE), Modern Geometry (MATHMODG), Numerical Analysis (MATHNUMA), Free Elective 1 (MTFELEC1), and Seminar in Thesis Writing (MTTHES11)[cite: 111, 114].

source: EARIST BS Mathematics Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Mathematics)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BS Mathematics program culminates with advanced analysis, thesis completion, and professional internship. The First Semester (18 units) requires Basic Accounting (BASICACC), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Complex Analysis (MATHCMPX), Real Analysis (MATHREAL), Free Elective 2 (MTFELEC2), and Thesis Writing (MITHESI2). [cite_start]The Second Semester (9 units) is dedicated entirely to the Practicum/Internship (MTINTERN), which serves as the final requirement for graduation[cite: 121, 124].

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Mechanical Engineering)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Engineering, offers the Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (BSME) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 205 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years and one summer term, focusing on thermal sciences, machine design, power plant engineering, and industrial processes.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Mechanical Engineering)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Mechanical Engineering program establishes the mathematical and scientific foundation for engineering. The First Semester (29 units) includes Engineering Drawing 1 (CENDRW 111), Differential Calculus (CENMAT01), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Mechanical Engineering Orientation (MEENG 111), Chemistry for Engineers (NATSCI SP 102), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (29 units) includes Computer Aided Drafting (CENCADIA), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), Calculus II/Integral Calculus (MATH_104), Physics for Engineers/Calculus Based (NATSCI103A), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Mechanical Engineering)
content: The Second Year of the EARIST BSME program focuses on core engineering mechanics, thermodynamics, and electrical basics. The First Semester (28 units) comprises Computer Fundamentals and Programming (COM SP 211), Basic Electrical Engineering (EEN 211), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Ethics (GEETHICS), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Statics of Rigid Bodies (MCH 311), Workshop Theory and Practice (MEN 212), Thermodynamics 1 (MEN 314), and Differential Equations (MM15). The Second Semester (23 units) covers Engineering Management (CVENG316), Basic Electronics (ECENG 222), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Advance Mathematics for ME (MATH 222B), Dynamics of Rigid Bodies (MCH 322), Thermodynamics 2 (MEENG 221), Machine Shop Theory (MEENG 222), and Engineering Data Analysis (MM16).

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Mechanical Engineering)
topic: Third Year Coursework and Summer OJT
content: The Third Year of the EARIST BSME program advances into fluid mechanics, machine elements, and specialized mechanical systems. The First Semester (26 units) includes Engineering Economy (CENENECO), Mechanics of Deformable Bodies (CENMECDB), Fluid Mechanics (FLUIDMEC), Heat Transfer (MEENG312), Machine Elements 1 (MEENG314), Vibration Engineering (MEENG315), Computer Application for ME (MEENG316), M.E Elective 1/Engine Friction and Lub (MEENG317), and DC and AC Machinery (MEMADCAC). The Second Semester (21 units) covers Method of Research for ME (MEENG321), Refrigeration System (MEENG322), Fluid Machineries (MEENG323), Combustion Engineering (MEENG324), Materials Science and Engineering for ME (MEENG325), Mechanical Engineering Lab 1 (MEENG326), M.E Elective 2/Design of Building Piping System (MEENG328), and Machine Elements 2 (MEENG329). The Summer term requires On-the-Job Training (CENOTJOB), consisting of 300 hours for 3 credited units.

category: College of Engineering Curriculum (Mechanical Engineering)
content: The Fourth Year of the EARIST BSME program involves complex system design, power plants, and professional practice. The First Semester (23 units) includes Technopreneurship (CENTECNO), Air-Conditioning & Ventilation System (MEENG411), ME Project Study 1 (MEENG412), Machine Design 1 (MEENG413), Mechanical Engineering Lab 2 (MEENG414), Control Engineering (MEENG415), Control Engineering Laboratory (MEENG416), and Power Plant Design with Renewable Energy (MEENG417). The Second Semester (23 units) concludes the degree with Industrial Plant Engineering (MEENG421), ME Project Study 2 (MEENG422), Machine Design 2 (MEENG423), Basic Occupational Safety and Health (MEENG424), Manufacturing & Industrial Processes with Plant Visits (MEENG425), Mechanical Engineering Lab 3 (MEENG426), ME Laws, Ethics, Contracts, Codes and Standard (MEENG427), and M.E. Integrative Course (MEENG428).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Special Needs Education)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Education, offers the Bachelor of Special Needs Education (Generalist) program. The curriculum is designed to prepare students for teaching learners with developmental, sensory, physical, emotional, and behavioral disabilities through a mix of general education, professional education, and specialized major courses.

category: College of Education Curriculum (Special Needs Education)
content: The First Year curriculum for the Bachelor of Special Needs Education (Generalist) establishes foundations in general education and child development. The First Semester (26 units) includes Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 1 (NSTPLTS1), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), and The Child and Adolescent Learners and Learning Principles (PEDCALLP). The Second Semester (26 units) includes Foundations of Special Education (FOSPINED), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 2 (NSTPLTS2), and NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Special Needs Education)
content: The Second Year of the BSNED Generalist program focuses on specific disabilities and professional teaching standards. The First Semester (26 units) comprises Practical Data Science (GEADDPDS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), The Teacher and The School Curriculum (PEDTSCUR), The Teaching Profession (PEDTTPRO), Learners with Sensory and Physical Disabilities (SNEDLSPD), Learners with Developmental Disabilities (SNEDLWDD), and Learners with Emotional, Behavioral, Language and Communication Disabilities (SNLEBLCD). The Second Semester (26 units) covers Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEADCPBR), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Facilitating Learner-Centered Teaching (PEDFALCT), The Teacher and the Community/School Culture (PEDTCSOL), Technology for Teaching and Learning 1 (PEDTFTAL), Curriculum and Pedagogy in Inclusive Education (SNEDCPIE), Educational Assessment of Students with Additional Needs (SNEDEASA), and Gifted and Talented Learners (SNEDGTLS).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Special Needs Education)
content: The Third Year of the BSNED Generalist program advances into instructional adaptations and specialized management strategies. The First Semester (21 units) includes Assessment of Learning 1 (PEDASOL1), Building and Enhancing New Literacies Across the Curriculum (PEDBELAC), Adapted Physical Education and Recreation (SNAPERMH), Behavior Management and Modification (SNEDEMAM), Transition Education (SNEDTRED), Instructional Adaptations in Language and Literacy Instruction (SNINALLI), and Instructional Adaptations in Mathematics and Science Instruction (SNINAMSI). The Second Semester (15 units) covers Assessment of Learning 2 (PEDASOL2), Development of Individualized Education Plans (SNEDDIEP), Early Childhood Inclusive Education (SNEDECIE), Instructional Adaptations for Teaching Content Areas (SNINATCA), and Research in Special Needs and Inclusive Education (SNRESNIE).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Special Needs Education)
content: The Fourth Year of the BSNED Generalist program (First Semester) focuses on final competency enhancement and field experience. It includes the Competencies Enhancement Program (PEDCOPRO), which requires the completion of all prior General Education, Professional Education, and Major courses (from First to Third Year) as prerequisites. It also includes Field Study 1 (PEDFSTDY1).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Office Administration)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Business and Public Administration (CBPA), offers the Bachelor of Science in Office Administration (BSOA) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 130 units for completion. The program structure spans four academic years, focusing on administrative skills, shorthand, research, and office management.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Office Administration

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Office Administration)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Office Administration program establishes foundational office skills. The First Semester (22 units) includes Administrative Office Procedure and Management (ADOPMNGT), Administrative Work Values and Accountability (ADWOVAAC), Foundation of Shorthand (FNDSTENO), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Keyboarding and Documents Processing 1 (KEYDOCPR), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (23 units) includes Advanced Shorthand (ADVSTENO), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Keyboarding and Documents Processing 2 (KEYDOCPR2), and NSTP 2 (NSTP-CWTS_2).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Office Administration)
content: The Second Year of the BS Office Administration program focuses on professional development and communication. The First Semester (17 units) comprises Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Personal and Professional Development (PRPROFDV), and Speed Transcription (SPDTRANS). The Second Semester (17 units) covers Accounting for Merchandising Industry (ACCOUNT2), Business Report Writing (BUSREPWR), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Science and Technology (GESCIENTS), and Office Administration Internship (300 Hours) (OAINTERN).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Office Administration)
content: The Third Year of the BS Office Administration program advances into specialized shorthand and research. The First Semester (15 units) includes The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Integrated Software Applications (INTSOFAP), Fundamentals of Machine Shorthand 1 (MACSHAN1), Internet Research for Business/BR1 (OABUSRS1), and Operations Management/TQM (OPTNMNGT). The Second Semester (15 units) includes Entrepreneurial Behavior (ENBEHAVE), Events Management (EVNTMNGT), Philippine Literature (GEPHILIT), Machine Shorthand 2 (MACSHAN2), and Basic Research/Thesis Writing/BR2 (OABUSRS2).

category: College of Business and Public Administration Curriculum (Office Administration)
content: The Fourth Year of the BS Office Administration program concludes with legal, strategic, and practical training. The First Semester (15 units) requires Business Law/Obligations & Contract (BUSLWOBL), Customer Relations (CUSTRELA), Income Taxation (INCMTAXN), Project Management (PROJMNGT), and Strategic Management (STRAMNGT). The Second Semester (6 units) is dedicated entirely to Legal/Medical Office Procedure (OAPRACTI), which serves as the final practicum.

source: EARIST BS Psychology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Psychology)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Arts and Sciences (CAS), offers the Bachelor of Science in Psychology program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 173 units for completion. The program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of psychological theories, research methods, and practical applications across four academic years.

source: EARIST BS Psychology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Psychology)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BS Psychology program establishes the biological and theoretical foundations of the discipline. The First Semester (25 units) includes Biological Science Laboratory and Lecture (BIOSCLAB/BIOSCLEC), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), Introduction to Psychology (INTROPSY), and National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1). The Second Semester (36 units) includes Anatomy and Physiology Laboratory and Lecture (ANAPYLAB/ANAPYLEC), Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), NSTP 2 (NSTP-CWTS_2), and Psychological Statistics (PSYCSTAT), which is a 5-unit course.

source: EARIST BS Psychology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Psychology)
content: The Second Year of the BS Psychology program focuses on developmental processes, experimental methods, and physiological bases of behavior. The First Semester (20 units) comprises Biochemistry Laboratory and Lecture (BIOCHLAB/BIOCHLEC), Developmental Psychology (DEVPSYCH), Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Sinesosyedad/Pelikulang Panlipunan (GESINEPP), and Physiological Psychology (PHYPSYCH). The Second Semester (21 units) covers Experimental Psychology Laboratory and Lecture (EXPSYLAB/EXPSYLEC), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEELECCP), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Physics for Psychology Students Laboratory and Lecture (PHYPSYLB/PHYPSYLC), and Theories of Personality (THEOPERS).

source: EARIST BS Psychology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Psychology)
content: The Third Year of the BS Psychology program advances into specialized fields and research methodology. The First Semester (20 units) includes Abnormal Psychology (ABNPSYCH), Cognitive Psychology (COGPSYCH), Field Methods Laboratory and Lecture (FLDMETLB/FLDMETLC), Ethics (GEETHICS), Industrial Organizational Psychology (INDPSYCH), and Social Psychology (SOCPSYCH). The Second Semester (23 units) covers The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Human Behavior in Organizations (HUMBEORG), Labor Laws and Labor Relations (LABORLAW), Disaster and Mental Health (MNTLHLTH), Psychological Assessment Laboratory and Lecture (PSYASSLB/PSYASSLC), Research in Psychology I (PSYTHES1), and Sikolohiyang Pilipino (SIKOLPIL).

source: EARIST BS Psychology Curriculum Checklist (Effective June 2018)
category: College of Arts and Sciences Curriculum (Psychology)
content: The Fourth Year of the BS Psychology program concludes the degree with advanced electives, research completion, and professional internship. The First Semester (18 units) includes Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Open Elective (OPENELEC), Organizational Development (ORGLDVMT), Positive Psychology (POSPSYCH), Research in Psychology II (PSYTHES2), and Strategic Human Resource Management (STRATHRM). The Second Semester (10 units) is dedicated to the Integrative Course in Psychology/Review Class (ICOPSYCH) and Practicum/Internship (PSYCHOJT), which carries 6 credited units.

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum (Tourism Management)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Hospitality and Tourism Management (CHTM), offers the Bachelor of Science in Tourism Management (BSTM) program. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, is structured to provide students with comprehensive knowledge in tourism operations, management, and sustainability over the course of four academic years.
keywords: Bachelor of Science in Tourism Management

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum (Tourism Management)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BSTM program establishes the foundation for tourism studies and general education. The First Semester (23 units) includes Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), Macro Perspective of Tourism and Hospitality (THCMACPR), Risk Management as Applied to Safety, Security and Sanitation (THCRISKM), and Sustainable Tourism (TPCSUSTO). The Second Semester (38 units) includes Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2), Micro Perspective of Tourism and Hospitality (THCMICPR), Quality Service Management in Tourism and Hospitality (THCQUASM), Global Culture and Tourism Geography (TPCGLCTG), and Recreational and Leisure Management (TPECRELM).

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum (Tourism Management)
content: The Second Year of the BSTM program focuses on specialized tourism management and operations. The First Semester (23 units) comprises Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Philippine Culture and Tourism Geography (THCPHCTG), Tour and Travel Management (TPCTTMGT), Eco Tourism Management (TPECECTM), Specialized Food and Beverage Service Operations (TPECSFBS), and Tourism Information Management (TPECTINM). The Second Semester (23 units) includes Operations Management in Tourism and Hospitality (BMECOPMN), World Literature and Humanities (GEADWOLH), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), Entrepreneurship in Tourism and Hospitality (THCENTRE), Legal Aspects in Tourism and Hospitality (THCLEGAS), Transportation Management (TPCTRANM), and The Ethics of Tour Guiding and Escorting (TPECETGE).

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum (Tourism Management)
content: The Third Year of the BSTM program emphasizes research, marketing, and specialized tourism sectors. The First Semester (24 units) includes Practical Data Science (GEELECDS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Tourism and Hospitality Marketing (THCMARKT), Multicultural Diversity in Workplace for the Tourism Professional (THCMULDI), Foreign Language 1 (THPCFLA1), Introduction to MICE Management (THPCMICE), Research in Tourism 1 (TPCREST1), and Tourism Policy Planning and Development (TPCTPPAD). The Second Semester (24 units) covers Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Professional Development and Applied Ethics (THCPDAET), Applied Business Tools and Technologies (THPCABTT), Foreign Language 2 (THPCFLA2), Research in Tourism 2 (TPCREST2), Cruise Tourism (TPECCRTO), Destination Management and Marketing (TPECDESM), and Tourism Product Development (TPECTPRD).

category: College of Hospitality and Tourism Management Curriculum (Tourism Management)
content: The Fourth Year of the BSTM program concludes with strategic management and industry practicum. The First Semester (15 units) includes Strategic Management and Total Quality Management (BMECSTQM), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Accommodation Operations and Management (TPECACOM), Philippine Gastronomical Tourism (TPECPHGT), and Travel Writing and Photography (TPECTWAP). The Second Semester (6 units) is dedicated entirely to the Tourism Practicum (TPCTORPR), which requires 600 hours of training in Transportation, Tourism Offices, Travel Agencies, or Airports. This practicum has extensive prerequisites covering major subjects from the first three years.

category: College of Education Curriculum (Home Economics)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Education, offers the Bachelor of Technology and Livelihood Education (BTLED) program with a specialization in Home Economics. The curriculum integrates general education, professional education, and major courses in home economics, industrial arts, and agri-fishery arts to prepare students for teaching and livelihood instruction.
keywords: Bachelor of Technology and Livelihood Education

category: College of Education Curriculum (Home Economics)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BTLED Home Economics program establishes foundations in general education and basic TLE concepts. The First Semester (32 units) includes Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 1 (NSTPLTS1), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), Home Economics Literacy (TLEEXHEL), Introduction to ICT I (TLEEXITY), and Consumer Education (TLEHECED). The Second Semester (32 units) includes Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 2 (NSTPLTS2), NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2), Entrepreneurship (TLEEXENT), Family and Consumer Life Skills (TLEEXFCL), and Introduction to ICT II (TLEEXIT2).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Home Economics)
content: The Second Year of the BTLED Home Economics program broadens into agri-fishery, industrial arts, and food service management. The First Semester (29 units) comprises Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEADCPBR), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), The Child and Adolescent Learners and Learning Principles (PEDCALLP), The Teaching Profession (PEDTTPRO), Introduction to Agri-Fishery Arts 1 (TLEEXAF1), Introduction to Industrial Arts I (TLEEXIA1), Household Resource Management (TLEHEHRM), and Principles of Food Preparation (TLEHEPFP). The Second Semester (29 units) covers Practical Data Science (GEADDPDS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), The Teacher and the Community/School Culture (PEDTCSPT), Technology for Teaching and Learning 1 (PEDTFTAL), Introduction to Agri-Fishery Arts II (TLEEXAF2), Introduction to Industrial Arts II (TLEEXIA2), Bread and Pastry Arts (TLEHEBPA), Food and Nutrition (TLEHEFAN), and School Food Service Management (TLEHESFM).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Home Economics)
content: The Third Year of the BTLED Home Economics program focuses on specialized home economics skills, research, and pedagogy. The First Semester (27 units) includes Assessment of Learning 1 (PEDASLT1), Facilitating Learner-Centered Teaching (PEDFLTM1), Foundation of Special and Inclusive Education (PEDFOSIE), Research I: Research In Home Economics 1 (RESINHE1), Technology for Teaching & Learning 2/TLE (TLEEXTTL), Arts in Daily Living (TLEHEADL), Child and Adolescent Development (TLEHECAD), Clothing Selection, Purchase & Care (TLEHECSP), and Fundamentals of Food Technology (TLEHEFFT). The Second Semester (24 units) covers Assessment of Learning 2 w/ Focus on Trainer's Methodology (PEDAL2TM), Building and Enhancing New Literacies Across the Curriculum (PEDBELAC), Curriculum Development and Evaluation (PEDCDTM2), Research II: Research in Home Economics II (RESINHE2), Beauty Care with Health & Wellness (TLEHEBCH), Clothing Construction (TLEHECCD), Crafts Design/Handicrafts (TLEHECDH), and Marriage and Family Relationships (TLEHEMFR).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Home Economics)
content: The Fourth Year of the BTLED Home Economics program (First Semester) focuses on field study and competency enhancement. Courses include Competencies Enhancement Program (PEDCOPRO) and Field Study 1 (PEDFSTDY1). The Field Study 1 course requires the completion of all major and professional education courses from the previous three years as prerequisites, including Assessment of Learning, Curriculum Development, and various specialized TLE subjects.

category: College of Education Curriculum (Industrial Arts)
content: The Eulogio 'Amang' Rodriguez Institute of Science and Technology (EARIST), through the College of Education, offers the Bachelor of Technology and Livelihood Education (BTLED) program with a specialization in Industrial Arts. This curriculum, effective as of June 2018, requires a total of 188 units for completion. The program is designed to equip future educators with technical skills in industrial arts, pedagogical knowledge, and research capabilities.
keywords: Bachelor of Technology and Livelihood Education

category: College of Education Curriculum (Industrial Arts)
content: The First Year curriculum for the BTLED Industrial Arts program establishes foundations in general education and basic technology concepts. The First Semester (32 units) includes Art Appreciation (GEARTAPP), Kontekstwalisadong Komunikasyon sa Filipino (GEKOMFIL), The Life and Works of Rizal (GELIFEWR), Mathematics in the Modern World (GEMATHMW), Movement Enhancement (GEPEMOVE), Science, Technology and Society (GESCIETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 1 (NSTPLTS1), National Service Training Program 1 (NSTPROG1), Home Economics Literacy (TLEEXHEL), Introduction to ICT I (TLEEXITI), and Graphic Arts (TLEIAGHA). The Second Semester (35 units) includes Living in Information Technology Era (GEELECIT), Filipino sa Iba't ibang Disiplina (GEFILDIS), Fitness Exercises (GEPEFITE), Purposive Communication (GEPURPCO), Readings in Philippine History (GEREADPH), Understanding the Self (GEUNDETS), NSTP Literacy Training Service 2 (NSTPLTS2), NSTP 2 (NSTPROG2), Entrepreneurship (TLEEXENT), Family and Consumer Life Skills (TLEEXFCL), and Introduction to ICT II (TLEEXIT2).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Industrial Arts)
content: The Second Year of the BTLED Industrial Arts program introduces specialized industrial and automotive technologies. The First Semester (29 units) comprises Communicative Proficiency in Business Correspondence (GEADCPBR), The Contemporary World (GECONTWO), Panitikan sa Pilipinas (GEPANIPI), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness 1 (GEPEHEF1), The Child and Adolescent Learners and Learning Principles (PEDCALLP), The Teaching Profession (PEDTTPRO), Introduction to Agri-Fishery Arts 1 (TLEEXAF1), Introduction to Industrial Arts I (TLEEXIA1), Civil Technology I (TLEIACT1), and Fundamentals of Automotive Technology (TLEIAFAT). The Second Semester (26 units) covers Practical Data Science (GEADDPDS), Ethics (GEETHICS), Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness II (GEPEHEF2), The Teacher and the Community/School Culture (PEDTCSPT), Technology for Teaching and Learning 1 (PEDTFTAL), Introduction to Agri-Fishery Arts II (TLEEXAF2), Introduction to Industrial Arts II (TLEEXIA2), Applied Automotive Technology (TLEIAAAT), and Civil Technology II (TLEIACT2).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Industrial Arts)
content: The Third Year of the BTLED Industrial Arts program focuses on electrical, electronics, and refrigeration technologies alongside research. The First Semester (27 units) includes Assessment of Learning 1 (PEDASLT1), Facilitating Learner-Centered Teaching (PEDFLTM1), Foundation of Special and Inclusive Education (PEDFOSIE), Research I: Research In Industrial Arts 1 (RESINIA1), Technology for Teaching & Learning 2/TLE (TLEEXTTL), Domestic Refrigeration and Air-Conditioning (TLEIADRA), Fundamentals of Electronics Technology (TLEIAFEE), Fundamentals of Electrical Technology (TLEIAFET), and Metal Works (TLEIAMWS). The Second Semester (24 units) covers Assessment of Learning 2 w/ Focus on Trainer's Methodology (PEDAL2TM), Building and Enhancing New Literacies Across the Curriculum (PEDBELAC), Curriculum Development and Evaluation (PEDCDTM2), Research II: Research in Industrial Arts II (RESINIA2), Applied Electrical Technology (TLEIAAET), Crafts Design/Handicraft (TLEIACDH), Commercial Refrigeration and Air-Conditioning (TLEIACRA), and Digital Electronics Technology (TLEIADET).

category: College of Education Curriculum (Industrial Arts)
content: The Fourth Year of the BTLED Industrial Arts program is dedicated to field study and teaching internship. The First Semester (9 units) includes Competencies Enhancement Program (PEDCOPRO), Field Study 1 (PEDFSTDY1), and Field Study 2 (PEDFSTDY2). The Second Semester (6 units) consists entirely of the Teaching Internship (PEDNTERN).
